value.content:
[
  {
    "type": "deprecated_algorithm",
    "severity": "critical",
    "algorithm": "RC4",
    "description": "RC4 stream cipher is deprecated due to multiple cryptographic weaknesses, including biases in the keystream that can lead to statistical attacks.",
    "evidence": "RC4-like initialization function detected at 0x1000015f4",
    "recommendation": "Replace RC4 with modern stream ciphers like ChaCha20 or use authenticated encryption modes like AES-GCM"
  },
  {
    "type": "weak_algorithm",
    "severity": "high",
    "algorithm": "Caesar Cipher",
    "description": "Caesar Cipher is an extremely weak substitution cipher with predictable encryption. Each possible shift can be easily brute-forced.",
    "evidence": "Caesar cipher encryption function detected at 0x100000af8",
    "recommendation": "Do not use Caesar Cipher for any serious encryption. Use modern symmetric encryption like AES."
  },
  {
    "type": "weak_algorithm", 
    "severity": "high",
    "algorithm": "XOR Cipher",
    "description": "XOR cipher provides no real cryptographic security. It can be trivially broken by known-plaintext attacks.",
    "evidence": "XOR encryption loops detected at 0x549 and 0x4f8",
    "recommendation": "Replace XOR cipher with authenticated encryption like AES-GCM"
  },
  {
    "type": "hardcoded_secret",
    "severity": "critical", 
    "algorithm": "General",
    "description": "Hardcoded secret key detected in binary, exposing sensitive cryptographic material",
    "evidence": "Hardcoded key string 'MySecretKey123' found in __TEXT,__cstring section",
    "extracted_value": "MySecretKey123",
    "recommendation": "Remove hardcoded keys. Use secure key management systems or key derivation functions like PBKDF2"
  }
]
